name: Idiopathic Aorto-Mesenteric Compression Syndrome
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain after eating and unexplained weight loss
symptoms: Unintentional 15% body weight loss over 3 months
Food fear due to pain association
treatment: Surgical vascular decompression via aortomesenteric bypass
Total parenteral nutrition for preoperative optimization
prognosis: Guarded - depends on timely intervention before irreversible bowel ischemia develops. 60% success rate with combined endovascular-surgical approach.
description: A rare vascular compression disorder where the superior mesenteric artery becomes pathologically compressed between the aorta and overlying structures, causing chronic mesenteric ischemia. This variant lacks the typical anatomical predispositions seen in median arcuate ligament syndrome.
risk_factors: Extreme physical training with core muscle hypertrophy
